techmeme.title: Spotify tells customers that its Car Thing dashboard accessory will stop working on December 9, less than a year after it went on sale, without offering refunds (Chris Welch/The Verge)
Screenshots of Google's AI Overview giving bizarre answers go viral, including telling users to add "1/8 cup of non-toxic glue" to make cheese stick on a pizza (Jyoti Mann/Business Insider)
Sources: Alphabet and Meta have talked to Hollywood studios about licensing content for AI video generation tools; Disney and Netflix aren't willing to license (Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg)
Sources: a16z, Sequoia Capital, and Tribe Capital commit to joining xAI's new funding round, in which the company seeks to raise ~$6B at an $18B valuation (Financial Times)
Sources: Helsing, which provides AI tools to militaries, is raising a $400M+ Series C led by General Catalyst at a ~$4B valuation, after raising $200M+ in 2023 (Forbes)
